affected-hours.label: Production Hours Affected
affected-hours.tooltip:
The value in this field must meet the following requirements: 
- a positive number
- a maximum of 6 digits before the decimal point
- a maximum of 2 digits after the decimal point.

This means that the highest number you can enter is 999999.99.

equipment.assigned-users-and-groups-tooltip: Select which users you want to assign this asset to. The users you select will receive notifications about the asset.

equipment.empty-state-message: Looks like you don't have any Equipment.

inherit-address.label: Use parent location
inherit-address.import-description: Select this checkbox to have the equipment record use its parent's location

parent-equipment-code.label: Parent Equipment Code
parent-equipment-code.import-description: The code of the equipment record's parent. If the parent is in the same import, its entry must appear before any other entries that reference it. Parent equipment code must match exactly or the import for this record will fail.

parent-location.label: Parent Location
parent-location.import-description: The parent site or location of this equipment

errors.no-format: No barcode format has been set. In order to generate a barcode, change your barcode settings in Equipment Categories.
errors.invalid: Invalid barcode. Please refer to the barcode format rules above

errors.range: Please enter a number between 1 and 10

errors.required-with-longitude: Latitude is required when longitude is entered

errors.required-with-latitude: Longitude is required when latitude is entered

barcode-details.note-message: Note: If you need to change the barcode format for this piece of equipment, you can update it in the equipment’s category (in Settings > Equipment Categories).

datamatrix.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the Data Matrix barcode format. This barcode format does not have a character limit. You can use any of the following types of characters:

upca.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the UPC-A barcode format. Barcodes with this format must contain 11 - 12 digits (with the 12th digit being used as a checksum), using the numbers 0-9.

ean8.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the EAN-8 barcode format. Barcodes with this format must contain 7 - 8 digits (with the 8th digit being used as a checksum), using the numbers 0-9.

ean13.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the EAN-13 barcode format. Barcodes with this format must be 12 - 13 digits (with the 13th digit being used as a checksum), using the numbers 0-9.

code128.detail-message:
This piece of equipment uses the Code 128 barcode format.

This barcode format does not have a character limit. You can use any of the following types of characters:

code39.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the Code 39 barcode format. This barcode format does not have a character limit. You can use any of the following types of characters:

interleaved2of5.detail-message: This piece of equipment uses the ITF barcode format. This barcode format can only contain the numbers 0-9. It does not have a character limit.

equipment.no-site-tooltip: "(No Site)" is the default parent for all assets. This means that if you don’t select a parent when setting up an asset, it will automatically be assigned to "(No Site)".
equipment.parent-tooltip: The parent you select determines where an asset appears in the hierarchy. For example, if you select a site as the parent, the asset is nested directly beneath that site in the hierarchy. You can also select another asset (such as a piece of equipment) as the parent to show that one asset is a component of another.

meter-type.tooltip-message:
Unidirectional meters: readings always go in the same direction (e.g. mileage on a car). These meters also include a Direction field to specify which direction readings can go (ascending by default)
Bidirectional meters: readings can go up or down (e.g. a temperature gauge)

criticality.cancel-back-to-eq: Cancel and go back to equipment list
criticality.probability-subtext: How likely is it that the equipment could fail before its next scheduled maintenance.
criticality.impact-subtext: How equipment failure might affect production.
criticality.criticality-score-subtext: Higher criticality scores indicate increased urgency in equipment maintenance.

criticality-analysis.title: Criticality analysis: What is it and how is it done?
criticality-analysis.content: To get the most out of your maintenance resources, you need to be doing the right work, on the right equipment at the right time. But how do we actually make the right decision consistently? In short, it all comes down to risk and managing it effectively. Performing a criticality analysis allows you to understand the potential risks that could impact your business, and this article explains why it's a critical task to complete and how it will help you get ahead.

asset-management-models.title: Develop an asset management model
asset-management-models.content: After you’ve assessed your equipments criticality, you need to decide on what specific activities need to be done for your equipment. What tasks need to be done? What frequency do these tasks need to be done? What equipment need PMs? Each criticality score warrants a different level of asset care and strategy. This article helps you understand which strategy is most appropriate for your different equipment.

failure-modes.title: A maintenance manager’s guide to creating and using FMEAs
failure-modes.content: A failure mode and effects analysis, or FMEA, identifies and documents all the ways a piece of equipment can fail and the potential impact of these failures. It is a useful tool to build a deeper understanding of your critical equipment. Read this article to understand how to start.
